intro: Scleria ciliata, commonly known as the fringed莎草, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes grasses and sedges. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and narrow, linear leaves with finely serrated edges. Its flowering spikes are typically cylindrical, bearing small, inconspicuous flowers that are wind-pollinated. Scleria ciliata is often found in moist, well-drained soils in wetlands, marshes, and along stream banks.
